algorithm_technique: Multi-source Breadth-First Search (BFS) starting from all water cells.
BFS to find shortest distance from water cells to land cells.
problem_summary_simple: Assign heights to a grid where water cells are 0, land cells are higher, and adjacent cells differ by at most 1, maximizing the highest peak.
problem_summary_technical: Utilizes multi-source BFS from water cells to assign increasing heights to land cells, ensuring the height difference constraint and maximizing the peak.
key_insights: The problem is equivalent to finding the shortest distance from any water cell to each land cell.
A multi-source BFS is ideal for this, starting all water cells simultaneously.
The height of a land cell is its distance from the nearest water cell.
